原因如下：


1. 大炒就榜首，大家會有心理壓力呢個位會有支持

2. 基本分析：爛廠都有三分釘，而家疫情時期大家都會明白唔買人呢個決定，今季唔課水就係市場恐慌居多，唔通全部球員唔踢阿仙奴咩

3. 圖表分析：根據達蛇理論，而家係行緊不敗型態，所以3分應該係基本分數黎，最多失兩球嚇下勝利球迷only

Excerpts from the article:

Arsenal’s pursuit of Lyon playmaker Houssem Aouar and Atletico Madrid defensive midfielder Thomas Partey is well documented and they will hope to get at least one of those deals done. Aouar currently looks the more likely, with Lyon needing to sell and the 22-year-old thought to be keen. Dialogue between Arsenal’s technical director Edu and his opposite number Juninho has been cordial and the Premier League club do have other options if they cannot land Aouar.

The Partey situation is complicated by Atletico Madrid, despite their own financial difficulties, insisting the only way the 27-year-old will leave is if his €50 million clause is activated and that would need to be paid in one go, as opposed to instalments. The requested salary and agent fees are also steep and Arsenal are unwilling to overpay when, again, they have back-up targets should an agreement not be found

Purchases will depend on whether Arsenal manage to move out the likes of Lucas Torreira, Matteo Guendouzi and Sokratis.

Roma expressed interest in signing Alexandre Lacazette but the amount the Italians indicated they were prepared to pay fell comfortably below what Arsenal would expect and that proposal is unlikely to go any further.

Link to Article: https://theathletic.com/2096090/2020/09/28/deadline-day-ornstein-sancho-lacazette-brewster/

quote.msg:
Excerpts from the article:

Arsenal’s pursuit of Lyon playmaker Houssem Aouar and Atletico Madrid defensive midfielder Thomas Partey is well documented and they will hope to get at least one of those deals done. Aouar currently looks the more likely, with Lyon needing to sell and the 22-year-old thought to be keen. Dialogue between Arsenal’s technical director Edu and his opposite number Juninho has been cordial and the Premier League club do have other options if they cannot land Aouar.

The Partey situation is complicated by Atletico Madrid, despite their own financial difficulties, insisting the only way the 27-year-old will leave is if his €50 million clause is activated and that would need to be paid in one go, as opposed to instalments. The requested salary and agent fees are also steep and Arsenal are unwilling to overpay when, again, they have back-up targets should an agreement not be found

Purchases will depend on whether Arsenal manage to move out the likes of Lucas Torreira, Matteo Guendouzi and Sokratis.

Roma expressed interest in signing Alexandre Lacazette but the amount the Italians indicated they were prepared to pay fell comfortably below what Arsenal would expect and that proposal is unlikely to go any further.

Link to Article: https://theathletic.com/2096090/2020/09/28/deadline-day-ornstein-sancho-lacazette-brewster/
